data.name: Find the row difference
data.description:
In first look it's easy, but isn't...

Given the arguments of the two lines, you have to find the difference between them.

You have to write function which will find: 1. Index where started changes 2. Symbols which were added 3. Symbols which were deleted

and return object with values:

```javascript { index: value, addedText: string, deletedText: string } ```

Examples

```javascript findDifferent('Hello, world!', 'Harry, world!') // { index: 1, addedText: "arry", deletedText: "ello" } // User click mouse from position 1 and select text 'ello' // Then paste text arry. // that's why function have to return {index: 1, addedText: "arry", deletedText: "ello"} findDifferent('It is hard task', 'It is easy task') // { index: 6, addedText: "easy", deletedText: "hard" }; findDifferent('Merry Christmas','Happy Christmas') // {index: 0, addedText: "Happ", deletedText: "Merr" }; findDifferent('33333','323') // {index: 1, addedText: "23", deletedText: "3333"} ```

If two string are the same then function has to return:

```javascript findDifferent('The same text', 'The same text') => {index: -1, addedText: '', deletedText: ''}; ``` If you think that it's easy, then try to finish this. Remember about repeated words, a few algorithms can handle this. ```javascript findDifferent('added','added added') // {index: 5, addedText: " added", deletedText: ""} ```
